meanings.definition: The practice of obtaining goods or services from an outside supplier, rather than producing them internally.
meanings.sent1: Insourcing has helped our company save money on production costs.
meanings.sent2: Many businesses prefer insourcing to maintain quality control.
meanings.sent3: The team joked that insourcing the coffee supply would lead to better morning meetings.
meanings.sent4: Insourcing the design work brought a fresh perspective to the project.
meanings.sent5: Insourcing allows for more flexibility in meeting customer demands.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing in jobs or tasks from an external source to be completed within a company or organization.
meanings.sent1: Insourcing of customer service has improved response times.
meanings.sent2: Insourcing IT support has enhanced our system efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The insourcing of birthday party planning made the office celebrations more fun.
meanings.sent4: Insourcing the event management added a professional touch to the conference.
meanings.sent5: Insourcing the cleaning services ensured a tidy workplace environment.
